intro: Dialium aubrevillei, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and broad, ovate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, semi-deciduous forests and is valued for its hard, durable wood. The plant also has traditional medicinal uses in some African communities.
